info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 11:25AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...
Ohio River at Tell City affecting Hancock and Perry Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at Tell City.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Indiana highway 66 closes above Cannelton. At 44.0 feet, Bottomland on both sides floods. Water reaches base of floodwall. At 46.5 feet, Flood gates in Hawesville KY close.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 30.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 30.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to 47.5 feet Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 47.5 feet on 03/24/1943. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
